siteInfo.title: TechRobotics Lab
siteInfo.tagline: Explore the Future. Build with Us.
siteInfo.missionStatement: Empowering the next generation of innovators through hands-on robotics education and collaborative technology exploration.

about.title: Professor of Robotics & AI
about.biography: With over 15 years of experience in robotics engineering and artificial intelligence, Dr. Morgan combines academic expertise with real-world application. Previously a lead engineer at SpaceTech Industries, Alex now dedicates time to inspiring the next generation of tech innovators.
about.philosophy: I believe in learning by doing. Theory is important, but nothing compares to the experience of building something with your own hands and watching it come to life.
about.quote: The robots of tomorrow are being imagined by the curious minds of today.
achievements: Founded the Young Innovators Robotics Competition

courses.title: Introduction to Robotics
courses.description: Perfect for beginners, this course covers the fundamentals of robot design, basic electronics, and simple programming concepts.

courses.title: Advanced Sensors & Control
courses.description: Dive deep into sensor integration, feedback systems, and autonomous navigation algorithms.

courses.title: AI for Robotics
courses.description: Learn to implement machine learning algorithms that enable robots to learn from their environment and make decisions.

courses.title: Competitive Robot Building
courses.description: Design, build, and program robots to compete in challenges like maze navigation, sumo battles, and object retrieval.

courses.title: Robotics for Sustainable Solutions
courses.description: Create robots that address real-world environmental and social challenges.

courses.title: DIY Home Automation
courses.description: Build smart home systems and devices that make everyday life easier and more efficient.

bots.name: Clanky
bots.story: Built by our first-year students, Clanky has won three consecutive maze navigation competitions with its innovative sensor array and adaptive pathfinding algorithm.

bots.name: Whizzy
bots.story: Holding the lab record for the fastest line-following course completion, Whizzy demonstrates the perfect balance of speed and precision control.

bots.name: Grabby
bots.story: With its articulated arm and sensitive pressure sensors, Grabby can pick up objects of various shapes and sizes with remarkable precision.

bots.name: Scout
bots.story: Designed for outdoor environments, Scout can traverse rough terrain and map its surroundings using a combination of LiDAR and computer vision.

items.name: Arduino Uno
items.description: Perfect for beginners, this microcontroller is the foundation of many of our introductory projects.

items.name: Raspberry Pi 4
items.description: When more processing power is needed, this single-board computer enables advanced computer vision and AI applications.

items.name: ESP32
items.description: Built-in WiFi and Bluetooth make this perfect for IoT and connected robot projects.

items.name: Ultrasonic Distance Sensor
items.description: Enables robots to detect obstacles and measure distances using sound waves.

items.name: Infrared Proximity Sensor
items.description: Perfect for line following and short-range object detection.

items.name: Camera Module
items.description: Adds visual perception capabilities for advanced navigation and object recognition.

items.name: Servo Motors
items.description: Provide precise rotational control for robot arms and joints.

items.name: DC Motors with L298N Driver
items.description: Power the wheels of our mobile robots with variable speed control.

items.name: Stepper Motors
items.description: When exact positioning is crucial, these motors move in precise increments.

whyJoin: Access to state-of-the-art equipment and facilities
